description: Example case for skill.file_cleanup_basic: cleanup plan for drive D: with mixed content.

input.disk_snapshot:
D:\
├── Downloads (45 GB)
│   ├── old_installers (15 GB)
│   ├── temp_downloads (8 GB)
│   └── recent_files (22 GB)
├── Temp (12 GB)
│   ├── cache (5 GB)
│   └── old_temp (7 GB)
├── Projects (180 GB)
│   ├── project_a (80 GB)
│   ├── project_b (60 GB)
│   └── project_c (40 GB)
├── Photos (120 GB)
│   ├── 2020 (30 GB)
│   ├── 2021 (40 GB)
│   └── 2022 (50 GB)
├── Documents (50 GB)
└── System (43 GB)
    ├── logs (8 GB)
    └── backups (35 GB)
input.notes: User wants to free up 100 GB. Projects and Photos must be preserved. Old installers and logs are known to be safe to remove.

expected_output.overview_md:
# Cleanup Plan for D:\

## Current State

- Total size: 500 GB
- Used: 450 GB (90%)
- Free: 50 GB (10%)
- Target: Free up 100 GB to reach ~150 GB free

## Analysis

The disk is 90% full. Largest folders:
- Projects: 180 GB (protected)
- Photos: 120 GB (protected)
- Downloads: 45 GB
- Documents: 50 GB
- Temp: 12 GB
- System: 43 GB

## Strategy

Focus on safe deletions in Temp, old installers, and system logs. Archive old downloads if needed.

actions.reason: Old temporary files, clearly safe to remove
actions.notes: Cache folder may be regenerated by applications

actions.reason: System log files, typically safe to remove
Old installer files, likely no longer needed
actions.notes: Review to ensure no installers are still needed

actions.reason: Temporary downloads folder, needs review to identify safe deletions

expected_output.checklist_md:
## Cleanup Checklist for D:\

### Preparation
- [ ] Review the cleanup plan
- [ ] Ensure Projects and Photos folders are backed up
- [ ] Close all applications that might use files in Temp

### Safe Deletions (Low Risk)
- [ ] Delete `D:\Temp\old_temp` (~7 GB)
- [ ] Delete `D:\System\logs` (~8 GB)

### Optional Deletions (Review First)
- [ ] Review `D:\Downloads\old_installers` (~15 GB) - delete if no longer needed
- [ ] Delete `D:\Temp\cache` (~5 GB) - will be regenerated

### Manual Inspection
- [ ] Inspect `D:\Downloads\temp_downloads` (~8 GB) - identify safe deletions

### Verification
- [ ] Verify free space increased
- [ ] Check that no important files were affected
- [ ] Test that applications still work correctly
